alert.note: Alert for Harnett; Johnston; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 14 at 3:01PM EDT until August 14 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN HARNETT...SOUTHWESTERN WAKE AND SOUTHWESTERN JOHNSTON COUNTIES... At 301 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles southwest of Fuquay-Varina, or 8 miles northwest of Lillington, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Lillington, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Angier, Benson, Holly Springs, Coats, Raven Rock State Park, Lake Benson and Buies Creek. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Raleigh.
